title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baycrest Hospital in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth, like day-to-day conversation. Interviewer was nice and friendly. Questions were straightforward and easy to answer. Starting off with self-intro, then questions related to job requirements, along with some scenario-based questions.
Interview Questions: How do you cope with stress?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Interview Descriptions: The interview team was very nice and friendly, interviewed by 3 people they made the environment pleasant and more like a conversation than an interview. Did not feel pressured. Shared what is expected of me in the role, their experiences and answered my questions about the position
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had a conflict with a coworker and how you resolved it.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Baycrest Hospital (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a remote interview by a panel of hiring manager, peers and another manager. Friendly individuals who were encouraging. Straightforward questions with no trick questions. I got a good idea of the position and of the people I would be working with.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your interest in dementia (my background was in youth).

title: Research Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: Phone meeting to screen first and set up time to meet in person. Meeting with PI to discuss job requirements and interview questions designed to assess your experience and fit and then research team to assess cultural fit.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Interview Descriptions: Interview  process was smooth and was  asked a lot of scenario questions. Some calculation questions. Interview lasted around 30 min. Not difficult at all, not many pharmacy questions. Relaxed  environment and friendly interviewers
Interview Questions: Tell me about Yourself? Patient-centered care?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Interview Descriptions: Met all supervisors in advance, used zoom for safety. Very inviting and relaxed. Collaborative and inviting environment. After resume reviewed, interview invite sent through email. Very easy to-schedule with with lots of flexible options, especially with children at home.
Interview Questions: Get to know you questions “why do you want to work here”

title: Marketing Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baycrest Hospital (North Toronto, ON) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: There was quite a bit of miscommunication when setting up the interview, even up until the morning f.  They never followed up to let me know I didn't get the job, though they said they would.
Interview Questions: What social media tracking and analytic programs have you used before?

title: PSw Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Baycrest Hospital (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: it was very easy. They really enaged in who you were as a person and wanted to get to know you to see how you relate to other people in the field
Interview Questions: what made you want to do psw

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Baycrest Hospital (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and short interview. The interviewer was very nice as well. There were not many questions asked, so I was able to know I got the position right away!
Interview Questions: What hours are you able to work?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baycrest Hospital (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through company website, was contacted by PI 1 month later, expressed interest in position via email, then was contacted via phone about interview time. Interview was in person. Entire application to interview took about 4-5 weeks.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with the geriatric population? Do you feel comfortable communicating with them/how would you keep them on task?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Baycrest Hospital (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Three people interviewed me including the researcher, lab manager, and an assistant. For some reasons, it took less than 10 minutes. The researcher received a phone call after I introduced myself.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are qualified for this position?

title: Volunteer Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baycrest Hospital (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly straight-forward and very accommodating. The managers and supervisors were very helpful and if for any reason, you were unable to come, they were understanding.  Overall, it was a pleasant experience and I encourage others to donate their time.

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baycrest Hospital (Toronto, ON) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received phone call to schedule interview with two members. Went into the interview, which lasted about 25 minutes. Teh whole process took about 3 weeks for everything to finish, which included background checks. They called 2 of my references.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What projects have you worked on?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Baycrest Hospital (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
One interview only. Simple behavioral questions and some technical ones. There are 2 interviewers who take turns to ask questions. Not scripted questions but more evolving. 
Overall process took only 2 months. First HR called to ask basic questions on salary expectations etc.
Interview Questions: They asked about specific skills i had to do the job

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baycrest Hospital (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from HR to come in for an interview. Interview took place the next week and lasted approximately 45 mins. I was interviewed by 4 people, which was followed by a computer-based test/activity. The interview questions included questions about background, the hospital (and particular department of position), and behavioural questions.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Baycrest Hospital (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Telephone Interview, followed by in person situational/behavioral interview with HR & Hiring Manager.
Interview Questions: Give an Example of a time you had to multiple priorities.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Baycrest Hospital (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview 2 months after I had applied for the position. Because so much time had passed, I assumed they were not interested. The interview itself was reasonable and all people in the surrounding offices were quite nice and helpful. I was interviewed by 3 individuals.
Interview Questions: If we were to call you references, what would be the one thing each of them would say about you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Baycrest Hospital (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied through a job posting online and I was invited for an interview. The interview consisted of a panel of 3 people. I was asked mainly behavioural questions about situations and experiences listed on my resume.
Interview Questions: Asked about how a time you have demonstrated Baycrest's core values.
